grammar_rules.title: Seboleli (Nouns)
grammar_rules.description: Nouns in Sesotho have classes (mehuta) that determine agreement with other words in the sentence.

grammar_rules.title: Leetsi (Pronouns)
grammar_rules.description: Pronouns replace nouns and agree with the noun class they refer to.

grammar_rules.title: Sephafi (Tenses)
grammar_rules.description: Sesotho verbs change form to indicate different tenses.
examples: ke ile ka ja (I ate - past)
ke tla ja (I will eat - future)

grammar_rules.title: Bonako (Aspects)
grammar_rules.description: Verbal aspects indicate how an action relates to time (completed, ongoing, habitual).

grammar_rules.title: Likutu-ketso tsa mahlomela (Verb Derivatives)
grammar_rules.description: Verbs can be modified to create different meanings through derivation.

grammar_rules.title: Sefetoli (Adverbs)
grammar_rules.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, or other adverbs.

grammar_rules.title: Mekhabo-puo (Figures of Speech)
grammar_rules.description: Literary devices used in Sesotho for expressive communication.
